title: Heritage backs bill banning TikTok
description: Heritage Action — the advocacy arm of the conservative Heritage Foundation think tank — revealed Monday it is backing a bill that would potentially ban TikTok in the United States. “Heritage Action SUPPORTS the bipartisan Protecting Americans from Foreign Adversary Controlled Applications Act. This bill will protect Americans from the influence of the CCP through TikTok,”…

title: White House: Biden ‘absolutely did not apologize’ for using term ‘illegal’
description: A White House spokesperson denied Monday that President Biden apologized for using the term “illegal” to describe an undocumented migrant during his State of the Union speech, after Biden said he had “regret” over his words. The man, accused of killing university student Laken Riley in Georgia, is a migrant from Venezuela who was not…

title: Driver says Trump didn’t lunge for wheel on Jan. 6 in newly released testimony
description: The driver of former President Trump’s car on Jan. 6 disputed bombshell testimony that he tried to take control of the car, even as the witness affirmed the former president’s insistence in joining his supporters at the Capitol.  The detail, released as part of a broader report from House Republicans that minimizes Trump’s role in…

title: Britt backlash stokes GOP fears about losing women voters

State of the Union response is shining a light on the GOP’s struggle to appeal to women voters ahead of November’s elections.  The rebuttal was met with an avalanche of backlash for being out of touch, with many critics calling the choice to have Britt sitting at a kitchen table for…

title: Gaza cease-fire movement is ‘a gift for Joe Biden,’ third-party leader says

title: Congress, sleep experts at odds over permanent daylight saving time
description: Most Americans set their clocks forward one hour this weekend for daylight saving time, part of the twice-yearly time shift that has been happening since the 1960s.  Some members of Congress want to put an end to the biannual time change by cementing daylight saving time year-round, while some sleep experts have lobbied for the…

title: Biden seeks modest bump for record $895B defense budget
description: The Biden administration’s defense budget for fiscal 2025 is only a 1 percent increase from last year’s, a slowdown in spending that will prevent the Pentagon from quickly refilling weapons stocks gutted by the wars in Ukraine and Israel, according to documents released Monday.  The $895.2 billion proposal, while the highest number ever for defense,…

title: Poland’s president calls on NATO allies to raise defense spending against Russian ‘war mode’ economy
description: NATO allies in Europe must bolster their defense spending to respond to Russia’s “war mode” economy, Polish President Andrzej Duda said Monday, calling Russia’s enduring incursion in Ukraine “the biggest threat to global peace since the end of the Cold War.”  “A return to the status quo ante is not possible. title: Five flashpoints from the Kimmel-Trump feud

title: Airbnb banning indoor security cameras
description: Airbnb will start banning the use of indoor security cameras in all listings globally at the end of next month, the company announced Monday. The goal of the policy shift, the company said, is to “simplify our policy on security cameras” while continuing “to prioritize the privacy of our community.” The revised policy also comes…

title: Mike Rogers wins Trump endorsement in Michigan Senate race
description: Former President Trump on Monday announced that he is supporting former Rep. Mike Rogers (R) in the Michigan Senate race, giving him a major primary boost. title: Trump supporters submit signatures to advance Wisconsin speaker recall
description: Supporters of former President Trump submitted close to 11,000 signatures as they look to recall Wisconsin Assembly Speaker Robin Vos (R).  The group looking to recall Vos submitted 10,700 signatures to the Wisconsin Elections Commission on Monday, according to the organizers. The Associated Press noted that the group needed 6,850 signatures to clear the threshold,…

title: Kathy Hochul’s latest terrible idea: Militarized public transit
description: Asking nearly a thousand Guard personnel trained to fight a war to become armed police without the proper training will make matters worse on the transit system, not better.

title: Key Colorado River conservation deadline arrives, with no consensus on the horizon

title: Biden effigy beaten at GOP event in Kansas; ex-official calls for resignations

title: Austin mayor expresses concerns over wave of self-driving cars, rail opposition

title: Trump dubs Carroll ‘Miss Bergdorf Goodman’ in dig at defamation verdict

title: Israel threatens the identity of American Jews
description: In short, for many American Jews, Israel is a test—a test of their deeply held conviction that being Jewish means doing good, and, if they determine Israel fails to measure up, they may conclude it does no good to be Jewish.

title: Remember the Rubymar: Stop Houthi attacks now
description: Will anyone remember the merchant ship Rubymar that sank last week in the Red Sea, a victim of a Houthi missile attack?

title: Biden is putting abortion politics ahead of health care once again
description: Pregnancy centers in states including Missouri and Pennsylvania that currently benefit from TANF funds would no longer be able to provide free ultrasounds, medical exams, housing, clothing and more to women facing unexpected pregnancies.

title: Democratic Senate group booking $239M in ads
description: A group that works to help elect Democrats to the Senate booked $239 million in television ads to defend seven seats that Republicans will seek to flip this fall.  Senate Majority PAC announced the ad buy in a release on Monday, saying the organization will supplement the reservations along with digital ad investments focused on…

title: Employers who spy on their remote workers do so at their own peril
description: Monitored employees are more likely to feel that the authority figure overseeing their surveillance is responsible for their behavior.

title: Poll: Bottom barrel government distrust is sinking deeper

title: America needs leaders with political courage
description: The American people are unrepresented and powerless. They want serious leaders who can unite the country.
